sourceMeaningMnemonic: You <radical>loiter</radical> around a <radical>tombstone</radical> to measure its <kanji>diameter</kanji>. You’re doing this to each tombstone, and if you loiter around long enough, you’ll soon know the diameter of every tombstone.
meaningInfo: Imagine loitering around a tombstone. You're leaning on it. You're staring at nothing. Oh, and you're also measuring its diameter.
readingMnemonic: You need to know the <kanji>diameter</kanji> of each tombstone so you can make <reading>ca</reading>kes (<ja>けい</ja>) for each one. But the cakes can't be wider than the tombstones, or they'll flop off onto the ground.
readingInfo: These carefully measured tombstone-diameter cakes are your special way of saying thanks to the ghosts for letting you loiter around their graves.
